summary:
Seeing Don always stick around with Brie, I believe that he will show up in Captain Marvel 2. Can not wait!
In  the comic at...
body:
Seeing Don always stick around with Brie, I believe that he will show up in Captain Marvel 2. Can not wait!

In the comic at least they kind of have a relationship.

Also that little nod in Endgame might give something away for the future movie, James Rhodes as Carol danvers potential love interest? 👏👏

summary: I just watched Avengers: Endgame and why is Steve old in the end???!! The serum makes his cells regenerate when damaged, he...
body: I just watched Avengers: Endgame and why is Steve old in the end???!! The serum makes his cells regenerate when damaged, he should not be able to age. I get the reasons they might have wanted to do that but it shouldn’t be possible!

Fan of BBC Sherlock & cast, with a good helping of Marvel these days. You might also find a bit of other shows and actors I like, music, politics, dogs, and random things that strike my fancy.  But mostly British men. 

I'm a nerd (professionally), musician (amateurishly), mom (haphazardly) - not necessarily in that order, most days.

blog.name: mcu-exchange
blog.title: MCU Exchange
blog.description: News • Videos • Features • Concept Art • Behind the Scenes

summary: An Evening with ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Writers Markus and McFeely
title: An Evening with ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Writers Markus and McFeely
excerpt: Explaining why they killed Black Widow, how they kept the story secret, how it is working for Marvel Studios, and more!
description:
On May 16, Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely came to Boston to talk about their work with Marvel Studios and the passion that they, and everyone at the studio, has for making these movies. They also shed light on some of the internal workings of Marvel Studios and reiterated what’s been said before that the studio is very flexible and open to new and fresh ideas.

When it comes to writing in the MCU, Markus talked about how useful it is having this backlog of story and characters to play with. For example, he mentioned that during the development of Civil War they needed a government official to introduce the Sokovia Accords and it just so happened that there was a government official in the MCU played by “William f-ing Hurt!” So as writers, they’re able to use this rich tapestry of storytelling to enhance the current film. And Endgame is almost an embodiment of that idea. The film references or connects to literally every other movie in the MCU, but it does so in a natural and organic way.

“The fact that when you’re telling a story there are things that need to happen that if you were writing a free standing movie it would just be ‘Steve gets in an elevator and just goes down.” But because you have this backlog you can reach back and go, ‘You know the other time he was in an elevator…’  So everything you would do anyway is given this enhanced meaning by having this big thing to draw on.” – Markus

[Read More]

blog.name: blackwidows-backup
blog.title: Marvel Obsessed
blog.description: I'm obsessed with all things Marvel.

summary: I Am Outraged At This Bullsh*t
body:
I Am Outraged At This Bullsh*t

“So far as matching the level of integrity of Captain America, Sam is pound for pound as morally forthright as anyone in the Marvel universe. And Bucky’s a damaged character.”

Like, what the f*ck?

I know I’m outraged a lot, but seriously? What the f*ck?

I’m going to start off with this: Bucky is under no circumstances a “damaged character”. He is not less of a person because of what he has been through. He is not less deserving because of his trials. He is not more untrustworthy because of his past.

The Russos really couldn’t just say Sam was cap because he deserved it, or because he’s been helping Steve all this time? They couldn’t say it was because Bucky wasn’t ready yet, or because he didn’t want to suddenly be a hero? No, they said it was because he’s a f*cking “damaged character”.

The soldier that was kidnapped, brainwashed, physically and mentally tortured, and forced to kill is a “damaged character”. He’s not damaged, he needs help. There’s a difference.

There’s a difference between “damaged goods” and people. The only thing they have in common is that they should NEVER be compared with one another.

Do you know how this sounds to someone who may be struggling in a similar way. I’m not talking about being brainwashed and kidnapped, I’m talking about real life people suffering from depression and PTSD. They’re not “damaged people” because of their conditions. They’re not “less deserving”.

This is a HORRIBLE message to send out into the world? I get it, maybe they said it without really thinking what they were saying, but that’s the issue here.

THEY NEED TO THINK BEFORE THEY F*CKING SPEAK IF THIS IS THE BULLSH*T COMING OUT OF THEIR MOUTHS.

Thank you for coming to my TED Talk, and remember: people are never “damaged goods”. Ever.

blog.name: doomedfanfics
blog.title: Because
blog.description: .:. I ❤️Clone Troopers .:. Tony Stark is king .:. Irondad Spiderson is life .:.

body:
Wake Me Up

“There’s something about dying that causes people to act hysterically. Not that I would disapprove if someone cried, lost some sleep, or fell into a pit of depression over my death. That’s right, my death. I, Tony Stark, husband, father, form super hero, am dead. Dead, deceased, expired.

It’s just that sometimes when people lose someone they love they sometimes do stupid things. I’ve done my fair share of stupid in the past, when I wasn’t dead, but this takes the cake. I would have never approved of such a mission, nor would I have taken part in such mission as it is.

Ok let’s be real, I totally would have done it if I were alive, and not dead, and if it was someone that I cared for a lot, that was dead. Like Pepper, definitely Morgan, hell even one teenage intern by the name of Peter Parker, whom by the way is going along with said plan.

I’m grateful, I really am. No really. It gives me all sorts of warm and fuzzy feels. Feels, everyone says feels right? But I’m gone. Finally at peace, finally resting. I don’t need bringing back. I don’t want to be brought back. I don’t… I need…

Who am I kidding? This place, what ever this place is, wherever this place is, it’s not heavenly. Though it’s not hellish either. If you believe in Heaven and Hell. This place is just… blank. There’s nothing, I’m nothing. It’s definitely not in my top five vacation places that’s for sure.

Maybe this is a hallucination. A dream. No, I’m dead, definitely dead. Their plan is never going to work. I’m dead.

I’m dead. Their plan isn’t going to work.

I’m dead.

I’m dead.

I’m dead…

…right?”

blog.name: dreamdragon48
blog.title: Poetic Wanderlust
blog.description: I reblog a lot so check my 'mygifs' tag for my gif sets. Feel free to ask questions or leave comments! Also, please do not repost my gif sets! Reblog is better! This blog is not Endgame friendly, or more specifically not Steve's ending friendly.

tags: most people already think we hate the ending because of a ship
genuine discourse about character growth for the win
let's try to show them the truth
summary: In light of Sebastian’s comments in London this weekend ( and I do have something to say to it, I just need to sort through my...
body:
In light of Sebastian’s comments in London this weekend ( and I do have something to say to it, I just need to sort through my thoughts first), I’m going to start posting this now:

If you are going to the Ace Con next month and see Chris, please, please, PLEASE if you ask him about Steve’s ending, be respectful.

Phrase it so it’s not an attack. Make sure that it doesn’t sound like you’re mad because of a ship or who got the shield.

Please try to to frame it so that he understands that we feel it doesn’t fit Steve’s arc and character development.

Examples could be: A lot of fans feel that the ending ruined Steve’s arc of learning to move on from the previous movies/was a disservice to him and Peggy Carter/made her seem like a prize he won for saving the world instead of living the peaceful life he deserved….

Or something like, Many of us were happy to see Steve retire but feel that his living out his life in the past ignored his character growth of acclimating to the future and only fulfilled a depression fantasy,…

Admittedly these probably need some work themselves but you get the idea. If you need help, reach out! I would be happy to help anyone edit or create the right question and I’m sure there are many on here who would also help.

And don’t boo him if he gives an answer you don’t like. He might be repeating the company line to keep in good with marvel so he can direct one day, he might still have to promote the movie, or he might genuinely like the ending. That’s his right. And it’s okay to disagree with him (not to his face but in general).

No matter what, just be respectful. It’s not his fault the ending destroyed Steve’s character development and arc. And he certainly has his own insight into the character. Be prepared for an answer we might not like.

I guess I’m just asking that we show our genuine concern for the character but show Chris that we still love him and what he did with Steve.

summary:
I just need to avoid endgame spoilers for ONE. MORE. DAY.
I’m going to see it tomorrow for my birthday and I’m gonna absolutely...
body:
I just need to avoid endgame spoilers for ONE. MORE. DAY.

I’m going to see it tomorrow for my birthday and I’m gonna absolutely obliterate any being, human or otherwise, who spoils it for me between now and then.

ARE WE CLEAR??

summary: acting like steve fans TURNED ON HIM because they didn’t like his ending is so fucking stupid like choosing to ditch his friends...
body: acting like steve fans TURNED ON HIM because they didn’t like his ending is so fucking stupid like choosing to ditch his friends when he just got them back after five years for a woman he almost had a relationship with over a decade ago IS OUT OF CHARACTER that’s all there is to it y’all it was not the only way to give him a happy ending and it does a disservice to his whole ass arc and his other relationships outside of peggy which are just as, if not more important to him I’M TIRED

title: Natasha and the shield
body: The shield also became hers over the years. There was this amazing theory on here that it was broken in half at the end because Nat was gone, but I’ll also add the evidence below. The shield is clearly featured in her credits segment. Not a coincidence.
